== Main Inclusion Report for graphicsmagick ==

=== Requirements ===

# ''Availability:'' http://archive.ubuntu.com/ubuntu/pool/universe/g/graphicsmagick, available for all supported architectures
# ''Rationale:''
** Build dependency of KOffice
** Compatible with and more stable than imagemagick, which will be moved to universe
 0. ''Security:''
** Three <nowiki>[[http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvekey.cgi?keyword=graphicsmagick|CVE entries]]</nowiki>.
** Various <nowiki>[[http://secunia.com/search/?search=graphicsmagick|Secunia history]]</nowiki>.
** No binaries running as root or suid/sgid.
** Does not open any port.
** Source code review:
 0. ''Quality assurance:''
** Package works out of the box without configuration.
** Package does not ask any debconf questions higher than priority 'normal'.
** No showstopper <nowiki>[[http://bugs.debian.org/src:graphicsmagick|Debian bugs]]</nowiki>.
** Good <nowiki>[[http://packages.qa.debian.org/g/graphicsmagick.html|maintenance in Debian]]</nowiki>.
** Active <nowiki>[[http://www.graphicsmagick.org/|upstream]]</nowiki>.
** No critical bugs in <nowiki>[[http://sourceforge.net/tracker/?group_id=73485&atid=537937|upstream bug tracker]]</nowiki>
** Does not deal with exotic hardware which we cannot support.
 0. ''Standards compliance:'' 
** Meets the <nowiki>[[http://www.pathname.com/fhs/|FHS]]</nowiki>, <nowiki>[[http://www.de.debian.org/doc/debian-policy/|Debian Policy]]</nowiki>
** Meets <nowiki>[[http://www.netfort.gr.jp/~dancer/column/libpkg-guide/libpkg-guide.html|Debian library packaging guide]]</nowiki> standards.
** Standard debhelper packaging, standard patch system.
 0. ''Dependencies:''
** All in main.

=== Reviewers ===
MartinPitt: approved IFF imagemagick will be demoted at the same time; they are both USN-heavy.
